intro: Centaurea stereophylla, commonly known as the pale centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in dry, sunny environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, with prominent central disc florets. Centaurea stereophylla is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it contributes to the biodiversity of mountain ecosystems.
